text: __NOTOC__ Talapar Conservation Park is a protected area in the Australian state of South Australia located in the state's Limestone Coast in the gazetted locality of Keppoch about north-west of the town centre in Naracoorte. The conservation park occupies land in sections 373, 374 and 402 of the cadastral unit of the Hundred of Glen Roy. It was proclaimed under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1972 on 2 June 1977. As of July 2016, the conservation park covered an area of . In 1992, the conservation park was described as follows. Firstly, the extent of “small interconnected ephemeral wetlands” had been “severely reduced” due to the effectiveness of regional land drainage and these areas may be restored by “minor earthworks on the northern side” of the conservation park. Secondly, soils with the conservation park are reported as being located in the “Bool Lagoon Environmental Association,” and consisting of “alkaline, shallow, weakly structured sandy soils” in the “better-drained areas” and “moderately deep, black, self- mulching, cracking clays” in the “poorly drained areas.” Thirdly, the conservation park was reported as containing the following six vegetation associations in 1992: #a woodland of South Australian blue gum, #a “low open forest-low woodland” of brown stringybark, #a “closed heath-open heath” consisting of Melaleuca neglecta, broombush and Leptospermum juniperinum, #a “low woodland-low open woodland” of either pink gum with a heath understorey or pink gum and South Australian blue gum over an understorey of broombush, and #an “open scrub-low open forest’’ of South Australian swamp paperbark in association with a “closed sedgeland” of Machaerina Juncea, Chorizandra enodis, Lepidosperma laterale and Leptocarpus brownii. As of 1992, the conservation park had “little visitor use” with the result that no visitor facilities had been provided with exception to vehicle access tracks with a width of to its perimeter to permit access when periodic flooding occurs. The conservation park is classified as an IUCN Category III protected area. ==See also== *Protected areas of South Australia ==References== ==External links== *Entry for Talapar Conservation Park on the Protected Planet website Category:Conservation parks of South Australia Category:Protected areas established in 1977 Category:1977 establishments in Australia Category:Limestone Coast
title: Talapar Conservation Park
